bibl.title: Joseph Mifford vs William Cochrane. Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

org.orgName: Third Judicial District Court of Washington

div1.p: FILE No. 6567
Territory of Washington County of King
In the District Court of the 3rd Judicial Dt forsaid Ty. holding terms at Seattle in King Co. W T.
Joseph Mifford Pett. vs Wm Cochrane Shff of King Co W. T.
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
To the Hon Thomas Burke Judge of the said DT Ct:
Your petitioner represents to your honorable court. That he is wrongfully retrained of his liberty by the above named William Cochrane Shff of King Co W. T.
That said William Cochrane as such sheriff wrongfully restrains this plaintiff of his liberty, in the County Jail of King Co W. T. in the City of Seattle W. T.

That heretofore trust on this morning of Tuesday the 12th day of February A D 1889, the said William Cochrane as such sheriff caused this plaintiff to be arrested and imprisoned in said Jail as aforesaid, and that said Cochrane in causing the said arrest and imprisonment, acted without any legal authority; that he had no warrant authority or duty said arrest and imprisonment, and that, in causing said arrest and imprisonment he was not acting under the direction or authority of any court or any Judge or any committing magistrate

2d - That the cause or pretense for thus restraining plaintiff of his liberty is not known to the ptff further than then that he believes said Cochrane thus holds him in custody as an act by reason of certain direction received by said
Cochrane by telegram, from Bakersfield Kern County Caly, and that said Cochrane holds the plaintiff under the directions in said telegram, the contents of which telegram are unknown to plaintiff

3rd The plaintiff says that said restraint and imprisonment is wrongful and illegal willing. That said plaintiff is thus restrained without process of law and committed asin and held in jail without any hearing, and arrested and imprisoned without any warrant or anything therefore

Wherefore plaintiff aver that a writ of Habeas Corpus issue upon directed wheresaid debt- commanding him to To bear the body of the plaintiff before the honorable court, and that upon said hearing plaintiff be fully returned and discharged from custody.
C. S. Gleasern Pallinson, Glasgow atts for Pet
I, Joseph Mifford on my oath say that I am plaintiff heard and have heard the foregoing petition read over and the pett and allegations therein contained in here as I believe. Jos L Mifford
Subscribed and sworn to by Joseph Mifford before me and in my presence this Febry 14 1889 J. M. Glasgow.
Notary Public in and for Washington Territory
NO 6567 Joseph Mifford vs William Cochrane Shff
Petition for Writ of Habeas Corpus

FILED FEB 14 1889 W E Ledgerwood Clerk By Deputy Clerk
C. S. Gleasern Pallison, Glasgow
